question.name: EstBySourceId
question.description:
Find ESTs by a list of IDs. Either enter the ID list manually, or upload a file that contains the list. IDs can be delimited by a comma, a semi colon, or any white spaces.

EST's have been clustered/assembled into "DoTS Assemblies" which represent consensus sequences of overlapping EST's and mRNA's. NOTE: You can query for DoTS Assemblies directly by using the Assemblies by EST Accession Query.

question.name: EstBySourceId
question.description: Find ESTs by ID. Either enter the ID list manually, or upload a file that contains the list. IDs can be delimited by a comma, a semi colon, or any white spaces. Also, the list may contain IDs from any of the EuPathDB organisms. For example, a list can be in the following form: "AA420947, EV500870, AU087658, AA009308, CV202103"

question.name: EstsByLocation
question.summary: Find ESTs that are located in a specified genomic region.
question.description:
Find ESTs within a given genomic region.
Enter a genomic sequence ID for any E. histolytica, E. dispar or E. invadens contig. The Start and End locations correspond to the coordinates of the EST(s) on the chromosome.

EST's have been clustered/assembled into "DoTS Assemblies" which represent consensus sequences of overlapping EST's and mRNA's. NOTE: You can query for DoTS Assemblies directly by using the Assemblies by Location Query.

Find ESTs within a given genomic region. The ESTs have not been mapped across species so be sure your genomic sequence ID and EST library choices are from the same species. For example, searching for C. muris ESTs on a C. parvum genomic sequence will return no results.

Select a C. parvum chromosome from the pull-down menu or enter the name of a contig for C. muris (e.g. 1104857754340), C. parvum or C. hominis (e.g. AAEL01000057). If you enter both, your result will include the union. The Start and End locations correspond to the coordinates of the EST(s) on the chromosome.
